key_points: Gabby Petito, a woman from Long Island, New York, has been reported missing.
James Schmidt, Petito's stepfather and former fire chief, has gone to Wyoming to join the search efforts.
Petito was last known to be in Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming, in late August.
Petito had been traveling with her boyfriend, Brian Laundrie, in a converted van on a cross-country tour of national parks.
Her family became concerned when her travel updates ceased in late August.
Brian Laundrie has returned to Florida without Petito and has refused to cooperate with authorities.
Police in North Port, Florida, have expressed interest in talking to Laundrie but have not accused him of any wrongdoing.
Petito's family has urged Laundrie to provide any information on her whereabouts.
Petito's biological father has urged the public to look out for anything "fishy" as the van life nature of their trip means they could be anywhere in the country.
Both the Schmidt and Petito families are appealing for help in locating Gabby.
spokespersons: James Schmidt (Former Fire Chief, Stepfather of Gabby Petito)
